abstract.p: eBay sets revenue goal of $3 billion in 2005; estimates size of its potential markets at about $1.6 trillion, increasing to about $2 trillion by 2005 (S)

block.p: Aggressively projecting continued strong growth, eBay has set a revenue goal of $3 billion in 2005, the online auction company said yesterday. EBay executives told analysts the goal would imply revenue growth ''approaching 50 percent a year.'' It based the goal on its estimate of the size of its various markets, including collectibles, practical items, computers and used autos and parts. EBay estimated the size of its potential markets at about $1.6 trillion, increasing to about $2 trillion by 2005.
